title: How to Get an Ink Stain out of a Men's Suit

steps.headline: Lay your men's suit on a flat surface.
Put a cloth under the stained area to protect the other layer of the suit from getting stained.
Blot the excess ink with a clean, white cloth.
steps.description: Blot only and do not rub because rubbing can cause the stain to spread.

steps.headline: Spray the stained area liberally with an aerosol hairspray.
steps.description: Let it sit for about 1 minute.

steps.headline: Blot the affected area with a damp white cloth to absorb the ink.
steps.description: Again, make sure to blot only and do not rub the fabric. Repeat the spraying and blotting process until the cloth is not getting any more ink. Change the cloth when it is saturated with ink so it won't re-stain the suit.

steps.headline: Use a white cloth damped with cold water to rinse the remaining solution.
Dry the area with a cloth towel.
Use a natural bristled clothes brush to brush your suit and make it look sharp.

text: Lay your men's suit on a flat surface.  Put a cloth under the stained area to protect the other layer of the suit from getting stained.  Blot the excess ink with a clean, white cloth. Blot only and do not rub because rubbing can cause the stain to spread. Spray the stained area liberally with an aerosol hairspray. Let it sit for about 1 minute. Blot the affected area with a damp white cloth to absorb the ink. Again, make sure to blot only and do not rub the fabric. Repeat the spraying and blotting process until the cloth is not getting any more ink. Change the cloth when it is saturated with ink so it won't re-stain the suit. Use a white cloth damped with cold water to rinse the remaining solution. Rinse thoroughly. Dry the area with a cloth towel.  Use a natural bristled clothes brush to brush your suit and make it look sharp.
